title.narrative: STRENGTHENING EVIDENCE BASED POLICIES

description.narrative: National capacities are strengthened for developing evidence-based policies and for effectively monitoring their implementation., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Human Rights Institutions, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, innovative partnerships and child rights platforms enable the increased commitment, cooperation and contribution of various stakeholders to the protection and realization of child rights in Croatia and beyond its borders.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacities are strengthened for developing evidence-based policies and for effectively monitoring their implementation.

description.narrative: UNICEF generated and utilized a substantive set of data, information and insights to inform and guide future programming as well as to increase national capacities (including media) for child rights monitoring and evidence-based policies. The implementation of theresearch, study and evaluation plan;informed improvements in programming for children and accelerating the implementation of child-friendly policies including National Plan for Combating Poverty and Social Exclusion, Child Guarantee National Action Plan and National Plan for Child Rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of journalists who gained additional knowledge on selected equity issues and the situation of the most vulnerable children(47895)

Extent to which UNICEF engagement with key data providers has contributed to increase their capacities for collecting and analysing quality and reliable dissagregated data on children, with specific focus on vulnerable groups of children (scale 1 to 4; 1-to a small extent, 2-to a moderate extent; 3-to a large extent, 4-to a very large extent)(47894)
Availability of high quality, participatory, child oriented and gender sensitive methodology for assessing the situation of child rights at local level(47892), Text

actual.value: 2021:Guidance for methodology implementation is under development; cooperation with the national partner is reinforced.
